story_arc: promise → course → data-staircase → pro/con → verdict → alternatives

primary_trope.name: tier_reveal
primary_trope.hook_text: 328 races. 14 dimensions. Where does 66° South Pyrénées land?
primary_trope.mechanism: Countdown / ranking — inherent escalation and social comparison.

beats.label: HOOK + PROMISE
beats.narration: Should you race 66° South Pyrénées? I rated 328 gravel races on 14 dimensions. 66° South Pyrénées scored 51 out of 100. Solid tier. Here's what that actually means for your season.
beats.editing_note: STATE THE PREMISE IN 8 SECONDS. Clear value prop: 'I rated 328 races. Here's where this one lands.' This is the 8-second decision window. Viewers who stay past 15s are 58% more likely to finish.
beats.psych_mechanism: Curiosity gap (specific) + IKEA effect (viewer predicts the tier before reveal).

beats.label: THE COURSE
beats.narration: 66° South Pyrénées. Pyrénées, France. 65 mi. Pyrénées mountain gravel.
beats.editing_note: Let the course breathe. Show the route map, then cut to terrain-specific B-roll. This is the SETUP phase — grounding the viewer before the data analysis. Pacing: 25-40 sec cuts.

beats.label: THE SCORES — Top 8
beats.narration: Time to break down the scorecard. Elevation. 4 out of 5. Serious elevation. Train your climbing legs. 2,134m over 110km delivers Pyrenees climbing with three major ascents including a two-step monster from km 72-87. Length. 3 out of 5. The Goldilocks zone of suffering. 110km hits the sweet spot for challenging gravel without becoming an endurance death march. Climate. 3 out of 5. The weather could go either way. Historical weather data shows average highs of 60°F and lows of 42°F, with a 47% chance of rain on any given day. Adventure. 3 out of 5. Genuine adventure elements. Expect the unexpected. Route explores varied terrain through Capcir, Formiguères, and around Lake Calvet with forest trails and rocky paths typical of the southwest Pyrenees. Experience. 3 out of 5. Memorable course. Has character. Post-race prize ceremony at 7 PM same day with music evening invitation creates proper celebration atmosphere. Community. 3 out of 5. Community is a real selling point. Regional French cycling culture runs deep, and the race builds on an established road event with local support. Value. 3 out of 5. The math works out. Barely. €80 for 110km includes timing, aid stations, medal, welcome bag, and 30% discounts on local activities like cable cars and spa access. Logistics. 2 out of 5. You'll figure it out. Eventually. On-site only packet pickup with complete file required screams bureaucratic nightmare, especially for international riders.
beats.editing_note: PROGRESSIVE RHYTHM: start tight (15-20 sec per dimension), slow down for the most interesting scores (30-40 sec). Each score: number appears, brief pause, explanation. Avatar reacts to extreme scores (5/5 = chef_kiss, 1/5 = facepalm). RE-ENGAGEMENT at 3:00 mark: insert a surprising score reveal or a meme reaction to break the pattern.

meme_insert.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

beats.label: THE SCORES — Also Scored
beats.narration: The rest, in rapid succession. Technicality. 2 out of 5. Mild technical demands. Pick decent tires. Altitude. 2 out of 5. Negligible altitude effect. Prestige. 2 out of 5. Regional reputation. The locals know. Race Quality. 2 out of 5. Nothing special about the race execution. Field Depth. 2 out of 5. Small but scrappy field. Expenses. 2 out of 5. Expensive. Travel and lodging add up fast.
beats.editing_note: FAST PACING — 7 seconds per dimension. Quick-fire energy change from the deep analysis above. This is a PATTERN INTERRUPT through pacing shift.

beats.label: STRENGTHS
beats.visual: Strengths list overlay with positive visual treatment
beats.editing_note: Warm energy. Each strength gets its own card. Avatar genuinely positive.

beats.label: WEAKNESSES
beats.visual: Weaknesses list with warning visual treatment
beats.editing_note: MIDPOINT RE-ENGAGEMENT. This is ~55% through. Open with burst sequence (quick cuts, warning sounds). Then deliver weaknesses honestly. Preview what's coming: 'Now, should you actually do this race?' [RIFF HERE] at the transition.

beats.label: LOGISTICS
beats.narration: Travel, lodging, and the unsexy details.
beats.editing_note: Utility section. Lower energy, practical value. Hybrid Tempo: alternate fast logistics items (10-15 sec) with slow map visuals (30 sec).

logistics: Fly into: Toulouse 1.5-2 hours or regional airports
Lodging: Pyrénées has moderate lodging options.

beats.label: VERDICT
beats.narration: Verdict: Pyrénées Mountain Gravel. If you're in France/Europe and want a Pyrénées mountain event. yes, it's solid. If you're international. there are better options.
beats.editing_note: CLOSE THE MAIN LOOP. 0.5s silence before verdict. Tier badge slams in. Avatar delivers final take. DO NOT signal 'wrapping up' — maintain energy.

beats.label: ALTERNATIVES
beats.narration: If 66° South Pyrénées isn't quite right for you. For better French events: Wish One Millau. For similar mountain events: other French/Spanish Pyrénées races.
beats.editing_note: Bonus value — viewers who reach this point are highly engaged. Cross-reference other videos/races.

beats.label: CTA
beats.narration: Full breakdown on the site. Fourteen scored dimensions. Free race prep kit. Link in the description.
beats.editing_note: End ABRUPTLY after CTA. No 'thanks for watching' wind-down.
beats.engagement_question: Have you raced 66° South Pyrénées? Did we get the score right? Drop it in the comments.

meme_inserts.suggested_clip: avatar reaction to most extreme score

thumbnail_prompt: South Park style flat cutout character, dramatic reveal pose, tier badge prominent, '66° South Pyrénées' bold text, tier badge 'SOLID', high contrast red/yellow/white, cycling gear, handlebar mustache --ar 16:9 --cref [CHARACTER_URL]

cross_platform_notes.youtube: Primary platform. SEO-optimize title for '[Race Name] review'.
cross_platform_notes.extract_shorts: Pull 3-5 Shorts: hook, biggest surprise score, verdict.
cross_platform_notes.blog: Cross-reference the race profile page for search traffic.

production_checklist: [ ] B-roll sourced (check broll_sources in each beat)
[ ] Music track selected (check BPM targets per beat)
